org.sbrubbles.conditio.policies

Class Policies<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.conditio.policies.Policies<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type to be returned by signal.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    HandlerNotFoundPolicy<T>, ReturnTypePolicy<T>

    public class Policies<T>
extends Object
implements HandlerNotFoundPolicy<T>, ReturnTypePolicy<T>
    A set of policies for a specific signal invocation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Policies()
      Creates a new instance using the default policies.
      Policies(HandlerNotFoundPolicy<T> handlerNotFoundPolicy, ReturnTypePolicy<T> returnTypePolicy)
      Creates a new instance using the given policies.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Class<T> getExpectedType()
      Applies the set policy for expected return type.
      T onHandlerNotFound(Signal<?> signal)
      Applies the set policy for missing handlers.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sbrubbles.conditio.policies.HandlerNotFoundPolicy

        error, ignore

      • Methods inherited from interface org.sbrubbles.conditio.policies.ReturnTypePolicy

        cast, expects, ignore

    • Constructor Detail

      • Policies

        public Policies()
        Creates a new instance using the default policies. These are:
        • error out on missing handlers; and
        • ignore returns on expected return type.
        See Also:
        HandlerNotFoundPolicy.error(), ReturnTypePolicy.ignore()

      • Policies

        public Policies(HandlerNotFoundPolicy<T> handlerNotFoundPolicy,
                ReturnTypePolicy<T> returnTypePolicy)
        Creates a new instance using the given policies.
        Parameters:
        handlerNotFoundPolicy - a policy for missing handlers.
        returnTypePolicy - a policy for the expected return type.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if one or both arguments is null.
        See Also:
        onHandlerNotFound(Signal), getExpectedType()

    • Method Detail

      • onHandlerNotFound

        public T onHandlerNotFound(Signal<?> signal)
                    throws HandlerNotFoundException
        Applies the set policy for missing handlers.
        Specified by:
        onHandlerNotFound in interface HandlerNotFoundPolicy<T>
        Parameters:
        signal - the signal that could not be handled.
        Returns:
        whatever the set policy returns.
        Throws:
        HandlerNotFoundException - if the set policy decides to error out.

      • getExpectedType

        public Class<T> getExpectedType()
        Applies the set policy for expected return type.
        Specified by:
        getExpectedType in interface ReturnTypePolicy<T>
        Returns:
        whatever the set policy returns. A null means that there is no expected return.
